titles.title: To designate the United States Post Office building located at 218 North Alston Street in Foley, Alabama, as the "Holk Post Office Building".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight. for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Postal Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight
House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Mr. McHugh moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Stevens without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 424.

bill.summary: 9/6/1995--Introduced. Designates the United States Post Office building located at 218 North Alston Street in Foley, Alabama, as the Holk Post Office Building.
